p: Now the graph-theoretical distance (topological) D G and the Euclidean distance D E between the vertices are measured, and a particular type of matrix, D E/D G, is formed from which the leading eigenvalues are calculated. The leading eigenvalue is used to characterise a sequence, while the difference between the eigenvalues forms an estimate of the similarity/dissimilarity between the sequences. Thus, the leading eigenvalues of D E/D G matrix and the associated eigen matrices are considered to be descriptors of the DNA sequences.
